title: Data Story
text:
About this site

It is undeniable that Taylor Swift has left a significant cultural impact in today’s society, evident not only through her numerous awards and Grammys, but also with her ongoing Eras Tour generating more than $5 billion (Music Expert Expounds on Taylor Swift’s Unmatched Cultural Impact, n.d.).
Additionally, she recently became the first person to receive the title of Person of the Year by Time Magazine for her achievement in the arts (ibid), underscoring her status as a cultural icon. Having been making music for almost 2 decades, a defining factor of her influence lies in the versatility of her music, where she started off her career with country music before transitioning to pop and indie folk genres (How Taylor Swift Masterminded Global Success, Explained by SOMD Experts | School of Music and Dance, n.d.).
Thus, examining the characteristics of her music throughout the years will provide an understanding about what led to this phenomenal success.
This leads us to the research question at hand: “How do the characteristics of Taylor Swift’s music vary across albums?” To do this, I picked out 3 key characteristics that define her music: (1) Danceability, (2) Acousticness, and (3) Tempo.

title: Data Story
text:
About this site

It is undeniable that Taylor Swift has left a significant cultural impact in today’s society, evident not only through her numerous awards and Grammys, but also with her ongoing Eras Tour generating more than $5 billion (Music Expert Expounds on Taylor Swift’s Unmatched Cultural Impact, n.d.).

Having been making music for almost 2 decades, a defining factor of her influence lies in the versatility of her music, where she started off her career with country music before transitioning to pop and indie folk genres (How Taylor Swift Masterminded Global Success, Explained by SOMD Experts | School of Music and Dance, n.d.).

title: Characteristics
text:
This is a Quarto website.
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

library(shiny)

Warning: package 'shiny' was built under R version 4.3.3

library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)


Attaching package: 'dplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag


The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

library(readxl)

# Import dataset

data <- read_excel("tsfeatures.xlsx")

New names:
• `` -> `...1`

# Define albums to exclude

albums_to_exclude <- c("folklore: the long pond studio sessions (from the Disney+ special) [deluxe edition]", "reputation Stadium Tour Surprise Song Playlist", "Speak Now World Tour Live", "Live From Clear Channel Stripped 2008")

# Filter out excluded albums

filtered_data <- subset(data, !album_name %in% albums_to_exclude)

# Define color palette for albums

album_colors <- rainbow(nrow(filtered_data))

# Define UI for application

ui <- fluidPage(

# Application title

  titlePanel("Characteristics of Taylor Swift's Music"),

# Tabbed layout with input and output definitions

  tabsetPanel(
  
  # Tab for bar plots
    tabPanel("characteristics", 
             fluidRow( 
               column(width = 4, 
                      selectInput(inputId = "feature_select", 
                                  label = "Select Feature:", 
                                  choices = c("Danceability", "Acousticness", "Tempo")), 
                      plotOutput(outputId = "barplot")) 
               ) 
             ),

  # Tab for custom text
tabPanel("Data Story", 
         fluidRow( 
           column(width = 12, 
                  textOutput("custom_text_output")) 
           )) 
) 
)

# Define server logic required to generate the bar plots and custom text

server <- function(input, output) {
  
  # Render bar plot based on selected characteristic
  output$barplot <- renderPlot({
    feature <- switch(input$feature_select,
                      "Danceability" = "danceability",
                      "Acousticness" = "acousticness",
                      "Tempo" = "tempo")
    ggplot(filtered_data, aes_string(x = "album_name", y = feature, fill = "album_name"))
    geom_bar(stat = "identity")+
      labs(title = paste(input$feature_select, "of Taylor Swift Albums"),
           x = "Album",
           y = input$feature_select) +
      theme_minimal()+
      theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))+
      scale_fill_manual(values = album_colours)
  })
}

shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)

Shiny applications not supported in static R Markdown documents
